content: 2004 Singaporean film ***Avatar*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 流放化身) is a 2004 English-language Singaporean [science fiction](/wiki/Science_fiction_film) [action film](/wiki/Action_film) directed by Kuo Jian Hong and written by Christopher Hatton. ## Plot In 2019, nearly everyone is identified by an [implanted](/wiki/Microchip_implant_(human)) [microchip](/wiki/Microchip_implant_(human)) and connected to the [cybernet](/wiki/Internet). Criminals use fake chips, known as "SIMs" (**S**imulated **I**dentity i**M**plants). [Bounty hunter](/wiki/Bounty_hunter) Dash MacKenzie is looking for a man who bought a SIM, and uncovers a game played by corporation heads to manipulate society. ## Cast - [Genevieve O'Reilly](/wiki/Genevieve_O%27Reilly) as Dash MacKenzie - [Joan Chen](/wiki/Joan_Chen) as Madame Ong - [David Warner](/wiki/David_Warner_(actor)) as Joseph Lau - [Wang Luoyong](/wiki/Wang_Luoyong) as Officer Victor Huang - [William Sanderson](/wiki/William_Sanderson) as Riley - [Lim Kay Siu](/wiki/Lim_Kay_Siu) as Julius - [Kumar](/wiki/Kumar_(Singaporean_entertainer)) as Zai - [Richard Low](/wiki/Richard_Low) as Uncle Ban - [Michael de Mesa](/wiki/Michael_de_Mesa) as Davinder Sandhu - Gerald Chew as Edward Chan - [T. Sasitharan](/wiki/T._Sasitharan) as Minister - Kate Wilson as Lt. Crowley ## Production *Avatar* was the first English-language film produced in Singapore. Filming took place in Singapore from April to May 2001 with the [working title](/wiki/Working_title) *Avatar Exile*. ## Release The film was first released on Russian television on 15 September 2004 before seeing a theatrical release in Singapore on 7 March 2005. Under the title *Matrix Hunter*, Pand Co. Ltd. issued a [DVD](/wiki/DVD) on 7 June 2005 and, as *Cyber Wars*, [New Line Home Entertainment](/wiki/New_Line_Cinema) released the film on [region 1](/wiki/DVD_region_code) DVD on 11 April 2006. ## Reception The film received generally negative reviews. Cheah Ui-Hoon of *[The Business Times](/wiki/Business_Times_(Singapore))* rated the film C−. Ong Sor Fern of *[The Straits Times](/wiki/The_Straits_Times)* gave the film a negative review. - Review at Beyondhollywood.com via Archive.org - *Cyber Wars* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) - *Cyber Wars* at [Rotten Tomatoes](/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes) This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub.
